main_definition: Underground refers to something occurring or existing beneath the surface, often secretive or unregulated.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to subterranean activities or spaces
meanings_and_examples.example: The underground tunnels were used for transportation and storage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Concealed from official knowledge, especially criminal activity
meanings_and_examples.example: Drug traffickers operate an underground market in this city.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to music genres that originated outside mainstream culture and often have rebellious themes
meanings_and_examples.example: Hip-hop was originally part of the underground music scene before becoming widely popular.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Annual period for farming when soil is prepared or cultivated below ground level
meanings_and_examples.example: The farmer started tilling his fields during the underground season to prepare for planting.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to a person who works secretly, often in violation of official policies or laws
meanings_and_examples.example: She was an underground activist fighting against government oppression.
